info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 9:19PM PDT until July 30 at 12:30AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... West Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 1230 AM PDT. * At 919 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along a line from Sandy Valley to Tecopa moving south. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This will impact Highway 127 as well as Kingston Road. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baker, Dumont Dunes, Tecopa, Sr 127 Near Dumont Dunes, Sandy Valley and Goodsprings. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
